intro: Gnaphalium fastigiatum, commonly known as the silverleaf everlasting, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are surrounded by pale green to silver bracts, giving it a distinctive appearance. It is often found in grasslands, meadows, and along roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils. The plant is known for its long-lasting flowers, which are used in dried floral arrangements.
